elements.name: Number_of_Full_Time_Employees_Number_of_Part_Time_Employees_a1
elements.title: How many unique, full-time individuals were employed by your organization as of the end of the reporting period?
elements.description: Enter a whole number. Do not include temporary workers or independent contractors.

elements.name: Number_of_Full_Time_Employees_Number_of_Part_Time_Employees_a2
elements.title: How many unique, part-time individuals were employed by your organization as of the end of the reporting period?
elements.description: Enter a whole number. Do not include temporary workers or independent contractors.

elements.name: Number_of_Full_Time_Employees_Number_of_Part_Time_Employees_a3
elements.title: How many full-time equivalent (FTE) full-time and part-time employees were employed by your organization as of the end of the reporting period?
elements.description: FTEs are calculated as an employee's scheduled hours divided by the employer's hours for a full-time workweek (e.g., for a 40-hour workweek, an employee scheduled to work 20 hours per week is 0.5 FTEs).

elements.name: Number_of_Full_Time_Employees_Number_of_Part_Time_Employees_b3
elements.title: Is there any additional information you would like to share on your organization’s employee count?

elements.name: Country_of_Legal_Registration_a1
elements.title: Where was your organization legally registered as of the end of the reporting period?
choices: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

elements.name: Countries_of_Operation_a1
elements.title: Where did your organization and any of its subsidiaries have physical operations at any point during the reporting period?
elements.description: Include all directly and indirectly controlled business sites and operations. Do not include employee living locations.
choices: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

elements.name: Countries_of_Sales_a1
elements.title: Where did your organization and any of its subsidiaries sell products or services at any point during the reporting period?
choices: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

elements.name: Countries_of_Sales_b1
elements.title: Is there any additional information you would like to share on your organization's geographic reach?

elements.name: question67
elements.title: Is there any additional information you would like to share on the sectors or industries that your organization operated in as of the end of the reporting period?

elements.name: Total_Revenue_a1
elements.title: What were your organization’s total revenues during the reporting period?
elements.description: Please enter the total amount of revenues generated by your organization from any source during the reporting period.

elements.name: Total_Expenses_a2
elements.title: What were your organization’s total expenses during the reporting period?
elements.description: Please enter all expenses incurred by the organization during the reporting period. For insurance providers, this metric excludes claims payments.

elements.name: Enterprise_Valuation_Total_Assets_a3
elements.title: Does your organization have access to data on its enterprise value including cash (EVIC) as of the end of the reporting period?
elements.description: For the definition of enterprise value including cash (EVIC), see the following resource: https://www.openriskmanual.org/wiki/Enterprise_Value_Including_Cash

elements.name: Enterprise_Valuation_Total_Assets_b1
elements.title: What was your organization’s most recent enterprise value including cash (EVIC) as of the end of the reporting period?

elements.name: Enterprise_Valuation_Total_Assets_c2
elements.title: Does your organization have data on its total assets, equal to the sum of current assets plus non-current assets, as of the end of the reporting period?

elements.name: Enterprise_Valuation_Total_Assets_c3
elements.title: What was the value of your organization’s total assets, equal to the sum of current assets plus non-current assets, as of the end of the reporting period?

elements.name: New_Investment_Capital_a4
elements.title: Does your organization have access to data on the amount of investment capital it raised during the reporting period?
elements.description: This metric is intended to capture the value of funds invested in the organization (both loans and investments) during the reporting period.

elements.name: New_Investment_Capital_b1
elements.title: How much investment capital did your organization raise during the reporting period?

elements.name: New_Investment_Capital_b2
elements.title: Is there any additional information you would like to share on your organization's financial data?

elements.name: Scope_1_Emissions_a1
elements.title: Does your organization have access to data on its Scope 1 greenhouse gas emissions during the reporting period?
elements.description: If your organization did not have any Scope 1 greenhouse gas emissions during the reporting period, answer "Yes" to this question and enter zero in the next question.

elements.name: Scope_1_Emissions_b1
elements.title: What were your organization’s Scope 1 greenhouse gas emissions during the reporting period?

elements.name: Scope_1_Emissions_b2
elements.title: Is there any additional information you would like to share on your organization’s Scope 1 emissions or its planned activities?

elements.name: Scope_2_Emissions_a2
elements.title: Does your organization have access to data on its Scope 2 greenhouse gas emissions during the reporting period?
elements.description: If your organization did not have any Scope 2 greenhouse gas emissions during the reporting period, answer "Yes" to this question and enter zero in the next question.

elements.name: Scope_2_Emissions_b1
elements.title: What were your organization’s Scope 2 greenhouse gas emissions during the reporting period?

elements.name: Scope_2_Emissions_b2
elements.title: Is there any additional information you would like to share on your organization’s Scope 2 emissions or its planed activities?

elements.name: Scope_3_Emissions_a3
elements.title: Does your organization have access to data on its Scope 3 greenhouse gas emissions during the reporting period?
elements.description: Scope 3 emissions are greenhouse gases emitted indirectly as result of activities from assets not owned or controlled by the reporting organization, but that the organization indirectly affects in its value chain.

elements.name: Scope_3_Emissions_b1
elements.title: What were your organization’s Scope 3 greenhouse gas emissions during the reporting period?

elements.name: Scope_3_Emissions_b2
elements.title: Is there any additional information you would like to share on your organization’s Scope 3 emissions or its planned activities?

elements.name: Revenue_from_Fossil_Fuels_a1
elements.title: Did your organization derive any revenue from the exploration, mining, extraction, production, processing, storage, refining or distribution, including transport, storage and trade, of fossil fuels during the reporting period?
elements.description: Coal, crude oil, and natural gas are all considered fossil fuels.

elements.name: Revenue_from_Fossil_Fuels_b1
elements.title: Is there any additional information you would like to share on your organization’s revenue derived from fossil fuels or its planned activities?

elements.name: Total_Energy_Consumption_a1
elements.title: Does your organization have access to data on the total amount of energy it consumed as part of its operations during the reporting period?
elements.description: If your organization did not consume any energy during the reporting period, answer "Yes" to this question and enter zero in the next question.

elements.name: Total_Energy_Consumption_b1
elements.title: What was the total amount of energy that your organization consumed as part of its operations during the reporting period?
elements.description: The includes energy purchased from sources external to the organization and energy produced by the organization itself for use.

elements.name: Total_Energy_Consumption_b2
elements.title: Is there any additional information you would like to share on your organization’s total energy consumption or its planned activities?

elements.name: Non_Renewable_Energy_Consumption_a1
elements.title: Does your organization have access to data on the amount of non-renewable energy it consumed as part of its operations during the reporting period?
elements.description: If your organization did not consume any non-renewable energy during the reporting period, answer "Yes" to this question and enter zero in the next question.

elements.name: Non_Renewable_Energy_Consumption_b1
elements.title: What was the total amount of non-renewable energy that your organization consumed as part of its operations during the reporting period?
elements.description: Non-renewable energy includes all energy not in this list: geothermal, solar, sustainably sourced biomass (including biogas), hydropower, and wind energy sources.

elements.name: Non_Renewable_Energy_Consumption_b2
elements.title: Is there any additional information you would like to share on your organization’s non-renewable energy consumption or its planned activities?

elements.name: Non_Renewable_Energy_Production_a2
elements.title: Does your organization have access to data on the amount of non-renewable energy it produced (i.e., generated for sale) during the reporting period?
elements.description: If your organization did not produce any non-renewable energy during the reporting period, answer "Yes" to this question and enter zero in the next question.

elements.name: Non_Renewable_Energy_Production_b1
elements.title: What was the total amount of non-renewable energy that your organization produced during the reporting period?
elements.description: If your organization generates electricity and then consumes the electricity, this energy should be counted only once under energy consumption (not energy production).

elements.name: Non_Renewable_Energy_Production_b2
elements.title: Is there any additional information you would like to share on your organization’s non-renewable energy production or its planned activities?

elements.name: Activities_Affecting_Biodiversity_Sensitive_Areas_a1
elements.title: Did the operations or activities of your organization negatively affect any biodiversity-sensitive areas during the reporting period?
elements.description: Biodiversity-sensitive areas include the Natura 2000 protected areas, UNESCO World Heritage Sites, and Key Biodiversity Areas. Negative effects are defined by GRI in Disclosure 304-2.

elements.name: Activities_Affecting_Biodiversity_Sensitive_Areas_b1
elements.title: Is there any additional information you would like to share on your organization’s operations or activities affecting biodiversity-sensitive areas or its planned activities?

elements.name: Intensity_of_Emissions_into_Water_a1
elements.title: Did your organization produce emissions of any of the following pollutants or contaminants into water sources during the reporting period?
elements.description: Priority substances are defined in Article 2(30) of Directive 2000/60/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council, found in Annex I on pages 12-13: https://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=OJ:L:2013:226:0001:0017:en:PDF

elements.name: Intensity_of_Emissions_into_Water_b1
elements.title: Does your organization have data on the amount of nitrates it emitted during the reporting period?

elements.name: Intensity_of_Emissions_into_Water_c1
elements.title: What was the total amount of nitrates that your organization emitted into water sources during the reporting period?

elements.name: Intensity_of_Emissions_into_Water_c2

elements.name: Hazardous_Waste_Production_b1
elements.title: Does your organization have data on the amount of hazardous waste it produced during the reporting period?
elements.description: If your organization did not produce any hazardous waste during the reporting period, answer "Yes" to this question and enter zero in the next question.

elements.name: Hazardous_ Waste_Production_c1
elements.title: What was the total amount of hazardous waste that your organization produced during the reporting period?
elements.description: Hazardous waste is defined in Directive 2008/98/EC of the European Parliament, as any waste that displays any of the hazardous properties listed in Annex III: https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/PDF/?uri=CELEX:32008L0098&from=EN

elements.name: Hazardous_ Waste_Production_c2
elements.title: Is there any additional information you would like to share on your organization’s hazardous waste production or its planned activities?

elements.name: Radioactive_Waste_Production_b1
elements.title: Does your organization have data on the amount of radioactive waste it produced during the reporting period?
elements.description: If your organization did not produce any radioactive waste during the reporting period, answer "Yes" to this question and enter zero in the next question.

elements.name: Radioactive_Waste_Production_b2
elements.title: What was the total amount of radioactive waste that your organization produced during the reporting period?
elements.description: Radioactive waste is defined in Article 3(7) of Council Directive 2011/70/Euratom (found on page 5): https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/PDF/?uri=CELEX:32011L0070&from=DA

elements.name: Radioactive_Waste_Production_b3
elements.title: Is there any additional information you would like to share on your organization’s radioactive waste production or its planned activities?

elements.name: Average_Female_Hourly_Wage_a1
elements.title: What was the average gross hourly wage (including basic salary and remuneration) paid during the reporting period to female full-time and part-time employees of the organization?
elements.description: Do not include temporary workers or independent contractors. Remuneration is defined as additional amounts beyond fixed, minimum amounts paid to a worker, including (but not limited to) bonuses, equity, benefits, overtime, and additional allowances.

elements.name: Average_Male_Hourly_Wage_a1
elements.title: What was the average gross hourly wage (including basic salary and remuneration) paid during the reporting period to male full-time and part-time employees of the organization?
elements.description: Do not include temporary workers or independent contractors. Remuneration is defined as additional amounts beyond fixed, minimum amounts paid to a worker, including (but not limited to) bonuses, equity, benefits, overtime, and additional allowances.

elements.name: Average_Male_Hourly_Wage_b2
elements.title: Is there any additional information you would like to share on your organization’s average gross hourly wages or its planned activities?

elements.name: Female_Board_Members_Total_Board_Members_b1
elements.title: Does your organization have data on the number of females members of your organization’s board of directors as of the end of the reporting period?

elements.name: Female_Board_Members_Total_Board_Members_c1

elements.description: Enter a whole number (no decimals).

elements.name: Female_Board_Members_Total_Board_Members_b

elements.description: Enter a whole number (no decimals).

elements.name: UNGC_Principles_Compliance_Policy_a1
elements.title: Did your organization have a policy in place to monitor compliance and handle complaints and grievances associated with the United Nations Global Compact (UNGC) Principles as of the last day of the reporting period?
elements.description: For more information on the 10 UNGC Principles, see the following link: https://www.unglobalcompact.org/what-is-gc/mission/principles.
